title: Good first experience
text:
Being our first ever snorkelling experience, it was safe to try in a peaceful less crowded bay. Dan was friendly, flexible and goes the extra mile when situation demands it.

Our taxi was not until two hours after the boat trip but he let us use his bathroom allowing us to stay in his house providing us with refreshments. For the cost and to meet a great human must try.
place: Snorkeling Boat Excursions in Nea Makri Athens

title: Location
text:
Located 1 km from syntagma metro / x95 which will drop u in syntagma when coming in from the airport, is situated round the corner to Hadrian’s arch with several restaurants near by. Taxis are plenty and the national park is near by too. The akropolis is less than half a kilometre away hence a central location but not too touristy.
The hotel ambiance is good , reception staff friendly to the correct amount and same old breakfast every day. Our room had balcony looking onto the outdoor pool , with a nice bathroom, CNN / BBC Television and good air con.

Breakfast is served on level 7 on the rooftop offering great views of the Acropolis and Athens, which was impressive.Did not try the bar but room service is good with polite staff.

Pictures are from the roof top and of the roof top restaurant .

title: Aegina
text:
There were several expensive options available to visit this island as part of 3 island hopper at 100 euros , private small cruises at 130. £ with swimming stops etc. We did the 8€ each way boat trip from Piraeus and visited the monastery and Aphaia temple , both of which took 10 minutes each ; with proper awareness of boat timings the island can be visited in all under 4 -5 hours: There are also the marina if one wants to swim / sun bathe or visit other smaller islands such as Agistri and Moni reachable through separate boats. I guess it all depends on what one wants to do in these trips, while swimming , island hopping or history/ pilgrimage etc.
Buses are infrequent,in Aegina , simply hire a taxi , and be done with it in 40 minutes if time is tight.There are several shops tempting with sampling pistachios which are okay , too salty , and not at all the overated hype ,just slightly better than the usual supermarket ones we get in UK.

Aphaia temple is a bit of history with stunning sea views and the monastery certainly offers tranquility.

title: Piece of history
text: 20 minutes from outside the fence will do for a quick glance or more if you want to read it all up which requires an entry ticket with last entry being 18:15 in October.

title: Journey back in time
text: It’s wonderful to be back in history and note the civilisation several hundreds of years ago. Entry and visit is easy , takes about 45 minutes to soak it all up. Aerial view of Athens is impressive. No food allowed whilst on the premises except water/ drinks. Tap water is available which is good when you run out.

title: Good vegetarian food
text: Central location, near Hadrian arch and akropolis area, comfortable ambience and great food. Had Lachan paratha which was just average but good garlic naan with okra and aloo gobi. Masala tea was typical Indian style and much needed after a full meal. Servers were polite and attentive.

title: Panoramic view from 30th floor
text: It’s difficult to locate the entrance to this palace due to poor sign posting but once in , it’s a quick lift ride to level 30 and beautiful night views of Warsaw. There are signs on the roof top as to what buildings each that are seen. We lost the online booking made but staff located our booking in their system and allowed us in.

title: Great food
text:
Visited today with family and had lamb,chicken sea bream and cheesecake between us.
Great taste, presentation and excellent service. Our waiter wuka was friendly and helpful.
If ever in Warsaw would like to eat here again.

title: Good food, reasonable price
text: We visited as a family of 3 and between us had fish soup, grilled chicken and salad, and chicken paprika with dumplings. All were good though found Hungarian restaurants good to be high in salt content. We recieved excellent service from a pleasant waiter. Would like yo visit again.

title: Worst food
text:
Just came out of this restaurant, having been terribly disappointed with their food, service and attitude. Ordered grilled chicken mozzarella which was very chewy and when asked the waiter said the grilled chicken will be chewy. He then asked if I wanted to try something else and I agreed to try the fish soup to find a small piece of fish in it with bones. Pictures attached.
Can’t believe the disproportionate number of people choosing to eat here and the quality of their food. My family had chicken Caesar salad which was chewy too and roast duck was chewy. Please choose to go if you are looking for mediocre food and something to chew on...

title: Sobering experience
text:
Visited here in March,a mind boggling experience that we could not stay beyond 40 minutes as it was too much.The clothes,bags,appearance of people are that of every day people we come across not something distant that it's impossible to stomach the scale of the destruction and the enormity of terrorism.
Definitely recommend to every one but I would not take little children ...we saw many onsite visiting with families.

title: Amazing view
text: It's a must see sight when in NYC best seen from many places but my favorite is from the ferry ride to Statue of Liberty

title: Location
text:
We are a couple of two having just returned from NYC.Stayed in double tree for 2 nights and it's just 3 minutes walk from port authority bus terminal.The lobby is milling with guests arriving and leaving but we had a very quick check in and an even quicker check out.Our room was on level 33 of a 36 storey building with good views and no noise but on wednesday when there was a comedy show ,even so the noise died down after midnight. The four elevators are particularly busy at peak times ,the can be a small wait.The coffee provided in the room was excellent quality and when we ran short of milk it was readily provided.The small refrigerator came in handy for cold drinks.The room was small indeed but modern and clean but a bit of dust floating about.Only oth gripe was the poor lighting in the room .The bathroom was clean with a vast supply of soft luxurious towels.The toiletries smelled great.
The reception staff collected our Amazon parcel before we arrived and happy to keep our luggage after check out.
Overall a great location,and walking distance of most areas of interest,good ambience and helpful staff and yes we would stay again.
place: DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel New York Times Square West

title: Worth it
Excellent views
text: Visited here the night of 20th March around 2040 and there was no queue.Took about 7 minutes to scan the New York pass , be issued with a ticket and clear security. We then take two lifts , the first stopping at level 67,then 69 before ultimately reaching the top of the rock at 70.360 degree view amazing. We much liked the open air access of the Rocks from two levels to the taller Empire State Building . At the rocks the people flow was much better than the ESB .

title: Great views
text: We visited on the night of 20th March at 2130 hours. We had the New York pass and took 10 minutes max of scanning the pass and security before we were in . Went round the building got onto the elevator to get first glimpse . Then we are taken on another levator to the top of the tree at level 86 and vow, what wonderful views. It’s amazing to see the numerous bridges across the Hudson and other landmark buildings dotted along the skyline. Then we take the lifts back to earth. Definitely recommend this building.

title: Interesting
text: It’s easy to locate in downtown Dallas. The atmosphere is vibrant and it’s nice to see the diverse food available. In addition to food there were crafts , vegetables, plants and pottery .

title: Worth the visit
text: Been here today. To avoid queue it is best to book online or buy from the shop on elm street. I was there at 10 for the 10’o clock entry.Got inside the museum by 10 20: The audio guide is very useful and the layout of pictures is self explanatory.The your transports one in time back in history and it was well worth the time and money.
place: The Sixth Floor Museum at Dealey Plaza

title: Excellent meals on revisit
text:
I had earlier been here in May 2018 and went back again to Shirdi in Oct 2018. We were a group of 5 including one child and all of us found the service and food quality to be great. One night they were close to finishing time when we turned up after she’s arti and they were obliging .
Will return.

title: Old habits die hard
text:
Visited this temple for the first time last week with elderly parent and a small child.
My experience : Poor guidance from temple employees about where to find the free darshan entrance.We were asked to go through the whole loop of queuing area even though there were hardly anybody ,approximately 10 people
2) When asked to accept the Saree and perform archana for the deity ,the priest were very rude asking me to Ho back and get the coconuts broken before entering the sanctum Santorum or moolavar.
3) All the while the priest kept muttering abuse how people don't know the procedures....
The Saree was finally taken and draped on the mahameru.As I said even though there were less than 10 devotees we were ushered out in seconds.I came round twice to get proper and satisfactory darshan of Ambal .
If you are like me living in virtual reality it was a wake up call as to the prevalence of caste discrimination in front of parabrahmam ,in this day and age.I can see why Dravidian movement is still active in Tamilnadu and can also see how it took root.
Nothing wrong with the god per se,but an unpleasant experience overall.

title: Serene
text:
This temple is situated away from the madding crowd and chaos of city life.
Car parking is large.The temple has facilities for washing feet and hands before entering for worship.There is a wheel chair availability and wheel chair access ,also,lift facilities.
The deities are so beautifully made in white marble.The sanyasis go about their business and one can spend as much time as one wishes.

The agarbathis sold by ISKCON was recommended to me which I have bought this week during my visit but yet to use.Noticed a vegetarian restaurant but did not try myself.
place: ISKCON Chennai, Sri Sri Radha Krishna Temple

title: Excellent art works
text:
I visited last week for the first time in 20 years of being a madrasi ,and regret not having come here before.I was hugely impressed by the workmanship of deities,numerous crafts and show case stuff available.The quality is superior which is reflected in the price.

The staff were surprisingly helpful when asked questions and even few volunteered information.There was no hard selling salesman talk which was helpful.
I will definitely be returning more often.

title: Arupadai veedu in 1 hour
text:
Wanted to view the temple after watching alamelu aachi video on you tube at 11 AMto find the temple closed at 11 . From the closed gate it appears to be spread out on a large area and seems to be maintained clean.

For those who are lucky enough to get in , it appears that all the 6 Veedus of lord Murugan can he vidited in an hour let alone a single day.

title: Ancient temple
text:
Ancient temple where Siva had given darshan to both sages valmiki and agastiar near the sthala viruksham which is vanni maram . Thiru marindeeswarar and thiru purasundari bless the devotees.

Some devotees were singing excellent siva hymn in Tamil( unknown to me) and lots others were “hands on deck” in preparation for the Anna abishegam and Anna danam due to happen later today got pournami.

The tank inside the temple has such huge fishes .

title: Peaceful
text:
Visited this afternoon and found the temple set in a large green and serene area. There is an arch on the ECR road “Saipuram” on the same side as direction of travel if going from Thiruvanmiyur to Injambakkam immediately adjacent to prarthana open air theatre.

Since the arti had finished for the afternoon, there were very few people. Sai is on an elevated platform making it practical for many to have good darshan even from a distance. Datta deity and meditation hall were indeed great.

title: Vandem guru paramparam
text: Visited samarth akkalkot Maharaj temple for the first time after reading guru charitram on the net.The audambar tree,swami's idol all instill great serenity.We felt blessed to have been pulled to the soil.

title: Busy temple
text: By the grace of Tulja bhavani we visited in October 2017.The car had to be parked a short distance away from the main entrance but it's a quick walk through narrow lanes.At the time of our visit we quickly reached the main deity within 15 minutes but realised there was a sudden bus load of people behind us.The darshan time depends on, if you are before or after the bus.The vibes inside the temple are very powerful and to be in a temple where samrat sivaji was given the sword by the goddess is an awesome experience.

title: Affordable stay
text: Om Sai Ram.This is run by sansthan and we had booked online.It was easy to get the keys,find the room and to check out.Mostly young boys are in employment and they seem to do their job and mind their business.In terms of cleanliness,the general area and the rooms are miles better than some of the private lodges.Its safe to stay and a short ride to the samadhi mandir on the bus or auto.Autos will charge you a flat rate.Food is available for a very nominal rate,including tea and coffee.There are many shops selling idli ,dosa,Panjabi food opposite the main gate.Overall a clean safe place for some body who doesn't speak the language.I will stay again.

title: Decent meal
text: We were Two adults visited for lunch after samadhi mandir darshan.we ordered both north and south Indian Thali each.The north Indian Thali was better.The ambience, cleanliness and service was good.

title: Peaceful Sai
text: I visited Mylai Sai temple with my elderly parents in Dec 2017 on Wednesday.there wa a long queue to get to Sai but the temple management makes provision for disabled elders to take darshan by avoiding the queue which is by helpful.I stood in the queue for about 20 minutes and had a peaceful darshan.Sai' s principles of anybody accessing him without intermediaries is evident in darshan where a devotee can hug Sai .offer garlands etc.Both Sai bless and Poojya Sri BV narasimha swami bless us all.Lunch was excellent with sambar and curd rice.more than sufficient for an adult.

title: Clean central friendly budget accomodation
text:
I was a solo traveller visiting dublin for 3 nights over the weekend and enjoyed friendly service in times hostel.I stayed in a four bedroom female dorm with ensuite;The room and bathroom was clean with fresh linen.You get breakfast for 3 Euros.Spacious kitchen with free wifi was available.

The location is within walking distance of Trinity college,stephens green and temple Bar.
The reception staff were helpful and friendly.I will go back again.

title: Wonderful panorama
text:
We were two adults in our 40s ,average fitness,climbed the Eiffel Tower upto the 2nd level with minimal difficulty.The queue was shorter for the stairs ,then took the lift to the top floor.You can buy the ticket to the top floor combining stairs and lift at the ground floor.

It's a wonderful experience and the view is amazing.

title: Manageable size ,wonderful museum
text:
The museum is not far from the solferino metro/musee d orsay metro stops.there was a small queue when we got there about 10 0'clock and we were inside the museum in 15 minutes.
The size of museum manageable without exhausting you. Took us about 3 hours to look at the recommended paintings.The down side is photography is not allowed and you can't get back in once you exit as opposed to the louvre.toilets are available either on -1 or level 6.

Overall an enjoyable experience.

title: Once in a lifetime experience
text:
The museum is a short walk from the metro and easily identifiable by the sheer size of it.The architecture is wonderful and takes your breath away.
To avoid the queue take the concord entrance instead of the pyramid one and you are right in front of the Billett office.once you have your tickets take a moment to plan how you are going to tackle this giant of a museum. there are three different wings each with -1to level 2 and the recommended paintings are scattered all over the place.

We sat down to have our coffee that we had carried in our flask when we noticed the sign this is not a picnic area. We then took a short stroll and indeed found a picnic area.Feel free to take your snacks and drinks as the food prices in the cafeteria is extortionate.we saw many a family who had packed some snacks.you will need food and a break given the size.Easily takes upto 4hours just to cover the recommended paintings.

The best museum so far (been to british museum and museum island,berlin)

title: Knee breaking ....
text:
The cathedral is a short walk from the metro and an even shorter walk from the RER line.The gothic architecture is wonderful.
There was'nt a queue when we got there for 9am,the church is open from about 8 0'clock.entry to the cathedral is free and the audio guide is available for purchase for 5 euros.
The cathedral is amazing,with wonderful glass work.There is a further counter to purchase tickets to view the treasury and it's definitely worth the 5 euros.There is a small gift shop before you exit.

To the right of the cathedral is where you queue to climb up about 50 steps to reach a counter to purchase the ticket for the tower tour and the queue had about 20 people at 0900 hours.
The climb of the cathedral towers is not for people who are cardivascularly challenged ;long ,winding stairs and at any given time only 5steps are visible.
Once you get to the top the view is amazing. Worth the climb.

title: Well maintained and interesting
text: The abbey is open to visitors mon -Saturday ,10- 1530;I visited on Saturday and was the only one and had the abbey all to myself.The gothic architecture is wonderful ,the audio guide and the little leaflet were informative.The ladies in the cafe were very helpful and friendly.It took me an hour to go round at a leisure pace.If you are pushed for time you could see this in 30 minutes.

title: Educative experience
text:
I visited the coats observatory,take note the entrance is through the paisley museum.Easy to locate only a short distance from paisley Gilmore station,if you followed the signs along the high street.
I attended the guided tour and the video,30 minutes each.It was an educative experience to learn that Pluto is no longer a planet?????
If you have kids they would appreciate it much more I think.

title: Short and sweet
text:
The museum is a small size when you compare to the likes of british museum or the berlin museum island.
It's a wee one as the scots say.
But it makes a change to be able to see a museum in a couple of hours.

title: Fantastic
text:
Architecture of the building is impressive and it sits majestically.The museum itself is divided into various sections ,telling us the story of foreign contribution to Scotland and a section on the famous architects of Glasgow.There was a small section on Egyptology .
Thee was the organ being played when I visited and it was well worth the wait.There was also a cafeteria within the museum which was handy.

title: Moving experience
text:
Palace of tears is just by the freidrichstrasse train station,both u and s bahn ,and is free entry.It tells us the story of innumerable lives that were uprooted and dishevelled by the wall.one gets a glimpse of The oppression by the soviets of the people of east berlin by watching the documentary film,which is a must see.For me a visit here was more informative in understanding the current noticeable difference between east and West Berlin.
Takes about 1 hour and there are clean toilets on site.

title: Pergamon was fantastic but....
text:
Pergamon museum was fantastic and incomparable to the rest of museums we have seen in England and Scotland.the Ishtar gate is a must see.The audio guides offer a lot of information.
The neues contained too little ..may be because we had seen the british museum and had been to egypt. However for the little there is ,there was a good amount of information.

Patience had run out ,so did not visit the bode museum.On reflection I think it was rather stupid to choose to spend in the museum ,inside closed walls,when there is so much history,world war stuff out in the open,berlin has to offer.(eg.platform 17, sachenhausen,Berlin Wall east gallery)

title: Downtrodden part of berlin.....
text: The graffittis were really good .Even as a Tourist it's such a relief to cross the border and get to the west....no offense,sorry the atmosphere is depressing and you can appreciate why people fled east for the west.see my post on palace of tears.

title: Awestruck
text: We visited pergamon for the first time with our teenage children and all four of us enjoyed the day.it took us 3hours to take it all in.It was an awesome experience to see the grandeur of the kings and the genius of man in the so called ,those old days with not much technology.unbelievable and fascinating.I particularly liked the great entrance wall and the Ishtar gate.well worth the money.

title: Educative and eye opening
text:
As you walk in you see a part of the Berlin Wall and the information centre itself has a chronologically arranged exhibit.it is an overpowering experience to learn all that happened under the nazis.It will easily take up to 3-4hours.The emotional impact of what man can do to man is indescribable.The audio guides are useful.

There is a cafe on the ground floor and a wc 1level beneath the ground floor.

title: Excellent collection of paintings
text: We enjoyed our visit to the national gallery in that there were Van Gogh,Picasso and Manet paintings amidst others.admission is free .

title: Great experience
text: The architecture was fantastic with things still working 80 years since construction(without any repairs) the temple itself was amazing .Must see!!

title: Educative
text:
This is to for the faint hearted.all those one ted with the medical profession ,current anf future doctors you are sure to enjoy it.
A very worthy experience .

title: Unusual but excellent
text:
You are bound to feel younger with all those toys you grew up with.
It's exciting to see pus from around the world.you will want to stay there.
Excellent cakes on sale.

title: Good food,great ambience
text:
My daughter and myself went to the Nancy's for lunch and we had a great time.
Food was excellent ,we ordered the wrap on beans,peripheries chips and extra hot peri peri chicken.

Their red wine was excellent too.
I have given 4 star because the music was too loud.

title: Good snacks,but service can be better
text:
We have been to Karahi about 4 times in the last 6 months.

Takeaway experience has been good in that food is ready for you to collect without any waiting.

However be it takeaway or eat in, u get a feeling " of being unwanted,unwelcomed",is that how others feel as well? I wonder.that is something for you to work on Karahi......

Food itself is good,especially the vegetarian samosas!!

title: Good service,good food
text:
We had a takeaway in April 2013 and the service in terms of flexibility in allowing us change things on the set meal,advise on what would be better etc was very good from the restaurant manager.
Food was ready for us without any waiting time.

Food itself was made of fresh ingredients.

title: Great geographical marvel
text:
Visiting this attraction was an experience that's hard to describe.the stones are formed by years and years of seismological changes and its humbling to be there even if its only for a few hours.
Should not miss it.

title: great day experience for the teenage kids too.
text:
Nice place to visit as u get to see animals kept in near to original habitat.
Takes a whole day,so go prepared for rain or wind and plenty of walking.the cafetaria served some excellent jacjet potatoes and cheese.

title: great day for kids and grown ups
text: The shows are particularly enjoyable and so is the food.

title: improved knowledge of glass making
text: Friendly and knowledgeble staff who took us through a journey of glass industry in the UK.

title: ENJOYABLE EXPERIENCE
text: Informative and enjoyable experience.The vision of the founders lever brothers is astounding.Very impressive architecture and town planning.sunlight soaps are avilable for sale and i bought it remembering my childhood.

title: great and enjoyable
text: staff and atmosphere are fantastic.The theatre itself has good seating arrangements.Beverages and ice creams were good too.

title: enjoyable
text: takes you through the history of canal trade in the UK,the lives of the boatmen,their living quartes etc.One can but admire the engineering knowledge in those days.hats off.Do not miss the short canal ride.
